https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/bwiexEIzrBHt2DaGhjt6yY3Pbyo.jpg In São Paulo, in the late 1960s, the convent of the Dominican friars became a trench of resistance to the military dictatorship that governs Brazil. Moved by Christian ideals, frets Betto, Oswaldo, Fernando, Ivo and Tito came to support the guerrilla group Ação Libertadora Nacional, commanded by Carlos Marighella. Baptism of Blood
